boat.name: Wanda
boat.full_description:
Designed on the lines lines of a Falmouth Quay punt by Harley Maud, 'Wanda' originally had no bowsprit and a small Bermudan mizzen. In a Beken photo of 1937, she's looking quite an 'ugly duckling', but in the ownership of BGC Scott, she raced with the Royal Ocean Racing Club, having been rigged with a short bowsprit improving her appearance and speed. During the 1930s the majority of RORC yachts were Bermudan and it seems that 'Wanda' and another gaff-rigged yacht, 'Griffin' were used to develop the racing rig for gaffers.

In the 1950s she had a doghouse fitted and Thornycroft petrol engine.

OGA member Colin Ryan cruised 'Wanda' on the East Coast and in 2006 she raced in the centenary RORC Cowes - Dinard race finishing 5th in her class.

More recently she has been cruising round Britain and spent two summers in the Western Isles off Scotland.
boat.short_description: 'Wanda' is a Harley Mead design built in the 1930s, originally rigged as a gaff yawl. In 1938 her mizzen was removed and she was refitted as a stem head gaff sloop. She is a very fast boat, close winded and wherever she travels will inspire and impress.
